column8: text

Barisan Nasional (BN) putuskan kerajaan tidak akan bentangkan RUU 355 selaras amalan BN berdasarkan keputusan konsesus - PM NajibSource Berita harian fb.Add the star article. KUALA LUMPUR: The Government has decided not to table the Private Member's Bill to amend the Syariah Courts (Criminal Jurisdiction) Act or RUU 355 in line with the principle of consensus, says Barisan Nasional chairman Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak (pic)."Therefore it will remain a Private Member's Bill and if it is presented, it will depend on the Speakers instructions," Najib, who is also Prime Minister, said on Wednesday night after chairing the coalition's supreme council meeting at its headquarters at Menara Dato' Onn here.The Bill was first tabled by PAS president Datuk Seri Abdul Hadi Awang in May last year, seeking to grant syariah courts the power to impose stiffer penalties on all crimes except those with the death sentence.Following fierce debates among lawmakers, Hadi presented a tweaked version of the motion in November last year and sought to defer it to be debated at the current Parliament meeting.Deputy Prime Minister and Umno vice-president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi recently said Putrajaya was committed to taking over the Bill and tabling it.MCA and many other Barisan component parties have continually expressed their objections and reservations about the Bill. In an immediate response, MCA president Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai said it was a good decision."Barisan will stick to the spirit of consensus," he said.Read more at http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...C4Rcd8p6wKQr.99

http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...-courts-powers/The StarWednesday, 29 March 2017 | MYT 10:41 PMGovt will not table RUU355 Billby razak ahmadKUALA LUMPUR: The Government has decided not to table the Private Member's Bill to amend the Syariah Courts (Criminal Jurisdiction) Act or RUU355 in line with the principle of consensus, says Barisan Nasional chairman Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak (pic)."Therefore it will remain a Private Member's Bill and if it is presented, it will depend on the Speaker's instructions," Najib, who is also Prime Minister, said on Wednesday night after chairing the coalition's supreme council meeting at its headquarters at Menara Dato' Onn here.In an immediate response, MCA president Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai said it was a good decision by Barisan."Barisan still sticks to the spirit of consensus," he said, adding that MCA strongly opposes the Bill.The Private Member's Bill was first tabled by PAS president Datuk Seri Abdul Hadi Awang, which seeks to grant syariah courts the power to impose stiffer penalties on all crimes except those with the death sentence.Following fierce debates among lawmakers, Hadi presented a tweaked version of the motion in November last year and sought to defer it to be debated at the current Parliament meeting.Deputy Prime Minister and Umno vice-president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi recently said Putrajaya was committed to taking over the Bill and tabling it.MCA and many other Barisan component parties have continually expressed their objections and reservations about the Bill.

Old news -http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...men-kata-zahid/BN akan bentang RUU 355 di Parlimen, kata ZahidFMT Reporters | March 18, 2017Zahid berkata, perkembangan itu memperlihatkan kerjasama kerajaan BN dengan 'rakan baru' yang pernah menjadi musuh politik suatu ketika dahulu.zahid-ruu355PETALING JAYA: Kerajaan Barisan Nasional (BN) akan membentangkan sendiri rang undang-undang meminda Akta Mahkamah Syariah (Bidang Kuasa Jenayah) 1965 atau RUU 355 di sidang Parlimen kali ini, kata timbalan perdana menteri.Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi yang dipetik Utusan Malaysia berkata, tindakan itu selaras hasrat Perdana Menteri, Datuk Seri Najib Razak yang begitu komited mengetengahkan hasrat berkenaan tanpa mengganggu-gugat kepentingan kaum dan agama lain di negara ini.Timbalan pengerusi BN itu berkata, perkembangan itu memperlihatkan kerjasama kerajaan BN dengan “rakan baru” yang pernah menjadi musuh politik untuk bersama memelihara kesucian agama Islam dan kedaulatan bangsa.“RUU 355 akan dibentang sendiri oleh kerajaan di Parlimen tidak lama lagi. Insya Allah dengan doa untuk kita menyatukan orang Melayu. Biarlah kita kehilangan segelintir ‘kawan’ kita, tapi kita akan dapat ‘kawan baru’ yang kumpulannya lebih besar bersama kita.“‘Kawan baharu’ kita ini mungkin dulu musuh politik kita, tapi mereka sudah faham untuk sama-sama tangani masalah (berkaitan Islam) dengan tidak mengetepikan agama lain,” katanya dipetik akhbar itu hari ini.Ahad lalu, Najib dilaporkan berkata, kerajaan pimpinan BN mengutamakan langkah mendahulukan rakyat dalam sebarang kerjasamanya dengan PAS demi memastikan kesejahteraan rakyat.Katanya, pemimpin parti berkenaan perlulah mengetepikan ideologi sempit politik kepartian dalam jalinan kerjasama sedemikian kerana ia tidak memberi keuntungan kepada mana-mana pihak.RUU 355 pertama kali dibentangkan Presiden PAS, Datuk Seri Abdul Hadi Awang di Dewan Rakyat pada Mei 2016 bagi memperkasakan Mahkamah Syariah.Ahli Parlimen Marang itu pada sesi terakhir Parlimen November lalu meminda usul itu dengan menaikkan hukuman penjara kepada 30 tahun, denda tidak melebihi RM100,000 dan maksimun 100 sebatan berbanding maksimum 3 tahun penjara, denda RM5,000 dan 6 kali sebatan yang boleh dijatuhkan Mahkamah Syariah ketika ini.
